sentence.Network_en: the rolling hills that characterize this part of England
sentence.Network_cn: 成为英格兰这一地区特征的绵延起伏的丘陵地

sentence.Network_en: We ordinarily characterize an action as responsible if it was intended.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果行为是有意的,我们一般将其特征归为应负责任的.

sentence.Network_en: Several different names have emerged to characterize different parts of the spectrum.
sentence.Network_cn: 几个不同的名称用来表示电磁波谱的不同部分.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'engrave, inscribe'): from French caractériser or medieval Latin characterizare, from Greek kharaktērizein, from kharaktēr 'a stamping tool'

entry.def: If something is characterized by a particular feature or quality, that feature or quality is an obvious part of it.

example.ex: This election campaign has been characterized by violence...
example.tran: 暴力行为已成为这次竞选活动的一大特点。

example.ex: A bold use of colour characterizes the bedroom.
example.tran: 这间卧室的特点是用色大胆。

entry.def: If you characterize someone or something as a particular thing, you describe them as that thing.

example.ex: Both companies have characterized the relationship as friendly...
example.tran: 两家公司都认为彼此之间关系友好。

example.ex: This play is characterized as a comedy.

means.word_mean: 1. describe or portray the character or the qualities or peculiarities of;

sentences.sentence: "You can characterize his behavior as that of an egotist"
"This poem can be characterized as a lament for a dead lover"

auth_sentence.content: The open horizontal communications that characterize Innotribe will have to spread throughout SWIFT.

auth_sentence.content: All the beliefs...that characterize our time are really designed to sustain the mystique of the Party.
auth_sentence.res_content: All the beliefs...that characterize our time are really designed to sustain the mystique of the Party.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: All the beliefs...that characterize our time are really designed to sustain the mystique of the Party.

auth_sentence.content: The obvious way to characterize Dangin, as a human Oxy pad, is a reductive one—any art student with a Mac can wipe out a zit.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 特有的,表示特性的,典型的
stems_affixes.word_buile: character特性,性质+istic……的→adj.特有的,表示特性的,典型的 n.特性, 特征

stems_affixes.value_cn: [事物的]特性, 性质, 特征[的总和], [人的]品质, 字符, 性格, 特征, 人物
stems_affixes.word_buile: charact特性,品质+er→性格, 特征
character特性,性质+istic……的→adj.特有的,表示特性的,典型的 n.特性, 特征
characterize[v.表现……的特色, 刻画的……性格]→v.表现……的特色

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表现……的特色, 刻画的……性格
stems_affixes.word_buile: character特性, 性质+ize表动词→v.表现……的特色, 刻画的……性格

Sentence.sentence: Under these circumstances, it's natural to look for what may appear to be the most "practical" way out of the problem "Major in a subject designed to get you a job" seems the obvious answer to some, though this ignores the fact that many disciplines in the humanities characterized as "soft" often, in fact, lead to employment and success in the long run.
What characterizes a knowledge economy according to the passage?
Disputes were characterized by intense verbal ( 言语上的) aggression, tended to be repeated and not resolved and made men, more than women, extremely angry.
What characterizes the stars nominated at Bell Labs?

jushi.english: The education system there is characterized by an emphasis on success in exams.
jushi.chinese: 那里的教育制度以强调考试成绩为特征。

jushi.english: An interest in people's deepest feelings characterizes all her writings.
jushi.chinese: 关注人们内心最深处的感情是她所有著作的特征。

jushi.english: The author characterized the central figure as a weakling.
jushi.chinese: 作者把故事中的主人公描绘成一个软弱的人。
